# ManifoldGL Project Context

## Project Overview
ManifoldGL (formerly IGBundle-LLM) is a research project adapting Large Language Models with Information-Geometric constraints.
It uses Hyperbolic Fiber Bundles to model semantic spaces, achieving +131.5% accuracy on ARC-AGI tasks.

## Key Documentation
- **Thesis**: /docs/wiki.html (Full mathematical and experimental details)
- **Codebase**: https://github.com/jesusvilela/IGBundle-LLM
- **Demo Guide**: /docs/demo.html (Instructions for local 4-bit inference)

## Architecture
- **Base Model**: Qwen2.5-7B
- **Adapter**: IGBundle (Fiber Bundle projection, Sheaf Consistency Loss)
- **Optimization**: Natural Gradient Descent (Fisher Information Metric)
- **Curvature**: Learned Hyperbolic (κ → -1)

## Setup
```bash
git clone https://github.com/jesusvilela/IGBundle-LLM
pip install -r requirements.txt
python trainv2.py --config configs/qwen25_7b_igbundle_lora.yaml
```

## Results
- Accuracy: 28.7% (vs 12.4% baseline)
- MFR (Manifold Faithfulness Rate): 94.2%
